original_datasets.name: Name of the dataset used or referenced in the study.
original_datasets.file_format: File format (e.g., csv, rdata, xlsx, json, parquet).
original_datasets.columns: List of key variable names or keys, if applicable.

summary_statistics.info: Structural metadata such as dimensions, column types, memory usage, or equivalent (e.g., output of df.info(), str(), etc.).
summary_statistics.describe: Descriptive statistics such as mean, std, min, max, etc., where applicable (e.g., df.describe(), summary()). If not available, return null.

access.url: Download or access URL if available.
access.restrictions: License or usage restrictions (e.g., CC-BY, restricted access, institutional).

original_datasets.notes: Any additional information or caveats (e.g., encoding issues, nested structure, missing metadata, unusual column formats).

replication_datasets.name: Name of the dataset used for replication.
replication_datasets.file_format: File format (e.g., csv, rdata, xlsx, json, parquet).
replication_datasets.columns: List of variable names or keys present in the replication dataset.

summary_statistics.info: Structural metadata such as dimensions, column types, memory usage, or equivalent (e.g., output of df.info(), str(), etc.).
summary_statistics.describe: Descriptive statistics such as mean, std, min, max, etc., where applicable (e.g., df.describe(), summary()). If not available, return null.

schema_mapping.original: List of corresponding column names from the original dataset.
schema_mapping.replication: List of matched columns in the replication dataset.

access.url: Download or repository URL if available.
access.restrictions: Any access or licensing restrictions (e.g., restricted, CC-BY, institution-only).

replication_datasets.notes: Any additional notes about the replication dataset (e.g., imputed values, row filtering, data transformation).

files.file_name: A detailed description of what this file does and how it relates to the dataset or experiment.

codebase.notes: Any overall notes on the code design, dependencies, or runtime environment.

docker_specs.base_image: A proper base Docker image that contains the necessary software to reproduce the original study (e.g., python:3.10, rocker/verse for R, etc.).

python: List of required Python packages with version constraints (e.g., numpy==1.23.1, pandas>=1.4.0)
r: List of R packages and versions (e.g., dplyr, ggplot2)
other: Other necessary software (e.g., git, make, wget)

hardware.gpu_support: true if GPU is required for model training or inference, false otherwise
hardware.min_gpu_memory_gb: Minimum GPU memory required in GB (e.g., 12)
hardware.min_ram_gb: Minimum system RAM required in GB (e.g., 16)

volumes: Suggested host paths to mount as volumes inside the container (e.g., ./data:/app/data)

analysis.instructions: Steps or code logic to run the analysis.
analysis.comparison_metrics: Metrics used to compare original vs replication results.
